data.text: @uche_blackstock I agree completely and thank you for pushing this message - in the bigger picture the AMA is not seeing the opportunity to highlight the importance of collaboration in Medicine. Trust and collaboration will be important tools to build better healthcare

@uche_blackstock The AMA has embraced a Mafia-like manipulation of supply and demand of medical services since the 1960s. I am not surprised that efficient access to life-saving medication is not their priority.
@uche_blackstock Thank you for speaking up and being our ally!

@uche_blackstock This hubris isn’t helpful.  With the pandemic it has been all hands on deck.  Divisive rhetoric is not conducive to public health. I love the #pharmacists I work with and we play off each other’s strengths and expertise.  AMA, do better.

@uche_blackstock Louder, for the dinosaurs in the back!
But seriously, Thank you for the support. If only AMA would realize that maximizing the role of rphs would HELP the PCP access crisis... please, gimme your chronic dx q3mo check ups. I'll be ALL over those HTN, DM, lipids, COPD, etc...
@uche_blackstock Oooh 6 whole pages. Pharmacists are literally the only people who care about drug interactions. These doctors are telling on themselves.
@jnicky63 @uche_blackstock I asked my oncologist a question about possible drug interactions when I was starting chemo, and she consulted with the hospital pharmacy because they are the experts!
